title: Review of prototype 2
text: imported data R, now need score . creating score specifications, definitions score created. score specifications stored table, row represents single score. scores_init object table storing zero scores. table number fields control score created: score always 0 1. score_type argument arguably important, defines method used create score. score type number specific arguments.
code: scores_init #> # A tibble: 0 × 12 #> # … with 12 variables: score_type <chr>, colname <chr>, score_name <chr>, #> #   weight <dbl>, lb <dbl>, ub <dbl>, centre <dbl>, inverse <lgl>, #> #   exponential <lgl>, logarithmic <lgl>, magnitude <dbl>, custom_args <list>

title: Review of prototype 2
text: arguments defined every score. colname argument defines column score creating using. score_name argument defines name score, used column name score added back original data frame. score_name “Default”, informative sensible default name used. weight argument defines weight score used calculate final score.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: exponential argument required scores. FALSE, score modified created. TRUE, exponential transformation applied score, need specify two additional arguments. score continue bounded 0 1. logarithmic argument defines whether transformation exponential logarithmic. TRUE, transformation inverted. magnitude argument defines magnitude transformation: higher number means transformation bigger effect.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: score_name “Linear”, linear score created. make score need specify lb ub arguments.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: column value less equal lb argument, score 0. column value equal ub argument, score 1. Otherwise, score defined proportion distance column value lb ub.  lb argument ub argument, score inverted. means lb produces score 1, ub produces score 0, etc.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: score_name “Peak”, peak score created. make score need specify lb, ub, centre inverse arguments. lb, ub centre arguments must numeric, centre must lb ub.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: column value less equal lb argument, score 0. column value equal centre argument, score 1. column value equal ub argument, score 1. column value lb centre arguments, score defined proportion column value along lb centre. column value centre ub arguments, score defined proportion column value along ub centre.  inverse TRUE, score inverted: lower bound upper bound produce score 1, centre produces score 0.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: score_type “Custom coordinates”, custom score created. allows define set coordinates, x coordinate value column, y coordinate score 0 1. score created connecting coordinates together. coordinates form data frame, x coordinates ‘x’ column y coordinates ‘y’ column.  can used create huge variety different scores.  add score table, use create_score() function. Lets create linear peak score. create_score() function also allows edit score, using editing argument. , edit linear score change weight. Note arguments give must always valid score added edited. Scores can deleted delete_scores() function. Enter vector containing multiple numbers delete multiple scores. can observe score created using score_summary() function. useful check score going create expect.
code: scores <- create_score(   scores_init, score_type = "Linear", colname = "x", score_name = "Default",    weight = 1, lb = 0, ub = 10, exponential = FALSE ) scores <- create_score(   scores, score_type = "Peak", colname = "y", score_name = "Default",    weight = 5, lb = 0, ub = 20, centre = 5, inverse = FALSE, exponential = TRUE,   logarithmic = FALSE, magnitude = 2 ) scores #> # title: Review of prototype 2
text: scored data, useful able filter sort . Filters stored table way scores . Use filters_init object get table 0 filters . Create filter add_filter() function. need specify initially column want filter. two types filters: numeric character filters. Numeric filters filter numeric columns using minimum maximum value. rows value specified column minimum maximum included filtered data frame. String filters filter string (word) columns using pattern. rows value specified column contains pattern included filtered data frame. can edit created filters edit_filter() function. can apply filters apply_filters() function.
code: filters_init #> # A tibble: 0 × 5 #> # … with 5 variables: type <chr>, colname <chr>, pattern <chr>, min <dbl>, #> #   max <dbl> filters <- add_filter(filters_init, "Score 1: x", final_data) filters <- add_filter(filters, "z", final_data) filters #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   type      colname    pattern   min   max #>   <chr>     <chr>      <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 numeric   Score 1: x NA        0.1     1 #> 2 character z          ""       NA      NA filters <- edit_filter(filters, 1, min = 0.5, max = 1) filters <- edit_filter(filters, 2, pattern = "a") filters #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   type      colname    pattern   min   max #>   <chr>     <chr>      <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 numeric   Score 1: x NA        0.5     1 #> 2 character z          a        NA      NA filtered_data <- apply_filters(final_data, filters[2,]) filtered_data #> # A tibble: 10 × 6 #>        x     y z     `Score 1: x` `Score 2: y` final_score #>    <int> <int> <chr>        <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> #>  1     1   100 a              0.1        0          0.0286 #>  2    11    90 a              1          0          0.286  #>  3    21    80 a              1          0          0.286  #>  4    31    70 a              1          0          0.286  #>  5    41    60 a              1          0          0.286  #>  6    51    50 a              1          0          0.286  #>  7    61    40 a              1          0          0.286  #>  8    71    30 a              1          0          0.286  #>  9    81    20 a              1          0          0.286  #> 10    91    10 a              1          0.208      0.434

title: Review of prototype 2
text: major part app ability predict price specified stock. First, certain stocks can ‘favourited’ using favourite_stock() function. Stock data can searched using search_stock() function. results show favourited stocks top. found stock want make predictions , can generate summary using stock_summary() function. Finally, predictions can made using predict_price() function. Specify stock, start date end date start making predictions. function can make daily monthly predictions, specify using freq argument. Make graph predictions using plot_predictions() function.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: custom_plot() function allows create vast number plots data. first argument function data, followed plotting method. rest arguments depend plotting method. argument specified format aesthetic = "column_name", aesthetic visual property variable can mapped (e.g. x, colour), column_name name column data. Currently, three different types graphs can created: line graphs, scatter graphs histograms.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: Create line graphs passing “line” plotting_method argument. Line graphs accept following aesthetics: x - variable x axis. y - variable y axis. colour - colour line. x y required arguments, meaning must supplied plot outputted.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: Create scatter graphs passing “scatter” plotting_method argument. Scatter graphs accept following aesthetics: x - variable x axis. y - variable y axis. colour - colour point. size - size point. shape - shape point. x y required arguments, meaning must supplied plot outputted.

title: Review of prototype 2
text: Create histograms passing “histogram” plotting_method argument. Histograms accept following aesthetics: x - variable x axis. colour - colour bar. size - size bar. x required arguments, meaning must supplied plot outputted. y aesthetic histogram frequency density x coordinate.
code: custom_plot(final_data, "histogram", x = "Score 1: x", colour = "z") #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: Create or edit a score specification — create_score
code: create_score(   scores,   editing = NA,   score_type = NULL,   colname = NULL,   score_name = NULL,   weight = NULL,   lb = NULL,   ub = NULL,   centre = NULL,   inverse = NULL,   exponential = NULL,   logarithmic = NULL,   magnitude = NULL,   custom_args = NULL )

title: Create or edit a score specification — create_score
text: scores data frame score specifications. See scores_init. editing row number score specification edit. NA (default), add newly created score end scores. score_type method use creating score. Either "Linear", "Peak" "Custom coordinates". colname name column score. score_name resulting name score. "Default", score given sensible informative default name. weight weight score calculating final score. See score_final(). lb linear peak score, lower bound score. produce score 0 cases. ub linear peak score, upper bound score. usually produce score 1 linear scores score 0 peak scores. centre peak score, centre score. produce score 1 unless inverse TRUE. inverse peak score, whether invert scoring method. exponential Whether apply exponential transformation resulting score. logarithmic exponential TRUE, whether invert exponential transformation. magnitude exponential TRUE, numeric magnitude exponential transformation. custom_args custom score, data frame coordinates used create score.

title: Create or edit a score specification — create_score
text: required arguments valid, scores returned . editing NA, scores returned ectra row. editing valid row number, scores 1 edited row returned.

title: Create or edit a score specification — create_score
text: score_name "Linear", linear score created. make score need specify lb ub arguments. column value less equal lb argument, score 0. column value equal ub argument, score 1. Otherwise, score defined proportion distance column value lb ub. lb argument ub argument, score inverted. means lb produces score 1, ub produces score 0, etc.

title: Create or edit a score specification — create_score
text: score_name "Peak", peak score created. make score need specify lb, ub, centre inverse arguments. lb, ub centre arguments must numeric, centre must lb ub. column value less equal lb argument, score 0. column value equal centre argument, score 1. column value equal ub argument, score 1. column value lb centre arguments, score defined proportion column value along lb centre. column value centre ub arguments, score defined proportion column value along ub centre. inverse TRUE, score inverted: lower bound upper bound produce score 1, centre produces score 0.

title: Create or edit a score specification — create_score
text: score_type "Custom coordinates", custom score created. allows define set coordinates, x coordinate value column, y coordinate score 0 1. score created connecting coordinates together. coordinates form data frame, x coordinates 'x' column y coordinates 'y' column. can used create huge variety different scores. detailed information, along plots demonstrate 3 scoring methods, see Prototype 2 vignette: vignette("prototype2", package = "financialDataAnalysis")

title: Create or edit a score specification — create_score
code: scores <- create_score(   scores_init, score_type = "Linear", colname = "x", score_name = "Default",   weight = 1, lb = 1, ub = 6, exponential = FALSE )  # Change the weight create_score(   scores, editing = 1, score_type = "Linear", colname = "x",    score_name = "Default", weight = 2, lb = 1, ub = 6, exponential = FALSE ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>   score_type colname score_n…¹ weight    lb    ub centre inverse expon…² logar…³ #>   <chr>      <chr>   <glue>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   #> 1 Linear     x       Score 1:…      2     1     6     NA NA      FALSE   NA      #> # … with 2 more variables: magnitude <dbl>, custom_args <list>, and abbreviated #> #   variable names ¹​score_name, ²​exponential, ³​logarithmic

title: Get the created scores from a scored data frame. — get_scores
code: data <- tibble::tibble(   x = 1:10 )  scores <- create_score(   scores_init, score_type = "Linear", colname = "x", score_name = "Default",   weight = 1, lb = 1, ub = 6, exponential = FALSE ) scores <- create_score(   scores, score_type = "Peak", colname = "x", score_name = "Peak score",   weight = 2, lb = 2, ub = 8, centre = 5, inverse = FALSE,   exponential = FALSE )  scored <- apply_scores(data, scores) scored <- score_final(scored, scores)  get_scores(scored, scores) #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    `Score 1: x` `Peak score` final_score #>           <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> #>  1          0          0          0      #>  2          0.2        0          0.0667 #>  3          0.4        0.333      0.356  #>  4          0.6        0.667      0.644  #>  5          0.8        1          0.933  #>  6          1          0.667      0.778  #>  7          1          0.333      0.556  #>  8          1          0          0.333  #>  9          1          0          0.333  #> 10          1          0          0.333
